message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DM, cs.CV, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with the problem of label noise in classifier learning, which is a common issue in machine learning. Decision tree learning is a popular algorithm for classification tasks, and the paper presents theoretical analysis to show that many decision tree learning algorithms are inherently robust to label noise. This makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses sample complexity results, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). The simulations conducted in the paper involve image classification, which could place it in cs.CV (Computer Vision) or cs.CL (Computation and Language).
